intro: Combretum oyemense, commonly known as the Oyem bush willow, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in open woodland and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
